alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 5:58PM EST until December 19 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... South Branch Raritan River At Stanton affecting Somerset and Hunterdon Counties. For the Raritan River...including Stanton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Branch Raritan River at Stanton. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, Minor low land flooding downstream of gauge. At 8.0 feet, Right bank and approach to bridge is flooded. At 10.0 feet, Houses downstream begin to take on water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 PM EST Monday was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 4.0 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.7 feet on 09/20/1989. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date South Branch Rar Stanton 8.0 9.6 Mon 5 pm 5.6 4.2 Crested & falling &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 600 AM EST.
